quiz.title: Unit 1: Foundations \u0026 Measurement (Quiz 10)
quiz.subtitle: Mass Addition, Dimensional Analysis, and Unit Conversions (10 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: The total mass of a bag is $1.8\,\text{kg}$. Two objects of $43\,\text{g}$ and $32\,\text{g}$ are added into the bag. Find the total mass of the bag after the combination to the correct number of significant figures.
questions.explanation: $43\,\text{g} = 0.043\,\text{kg}$, $32\,\text{g} = 0.032\,\text{kg}$. Total $= 1.8 + 0.043 + 0.032 = 1.875\,\text{kg}$. $1.8$ has 1 decimal place, so result rounds to $1.9\,\text{kg}$.

questions.question: A container has a mass of $2.35\,\text{kg}$. Three stones of masses $127\,\text{g}$, $84\,\text{g}$, and $56\,\text{g}$ are placed inside. What is the total mass to the correct number of significant figures?
questions.explanation: $127\,\text{g} = 0.127\,\text{kg}$, $84\,\text{g} = 0.084\,\text{kg}$, $56\,\text{g} = 0.056\,\text{kg}$. Total $= 2.35 + 0.127 + 0.084 + 0.056 = 2.617\,\text{kg}$. $2.35$ has 2 decimal places, so result rounds to $2.62\,\text{kg}$.

questions.question: Given that Mass $= M$, Length $= L$, and Time $= T$, what is the dimension for Work? (Work $=$ Force $\times$ Displacement, Force $=$ Mass $\times$ Acceleration, Acceleration $=$ Velocity$/T$, Velocity $=$ Displacement$/T$)
questions.explanation: Velocity $= LT^{-1}$, Acceleration $= LT^{-2}$, Force $= MLT^{-2}$, Work $= MLT^{-2} \times L = ML^2T^{-2}$.

questions.question: Given that Mass $= M$, Length $= L$, and Time $= T$, what is the dimension for Momentum? (Momentum $=$ Mass $\times$ Velocity)
questions.explanation: Velocity $= LT^{-1}$, Momentum $= M \times LT^{-1} = MLT^{-1}$.

questions.question: Given that Mass $= M$, Length $= L$, and Time $= T$, what is the dimension for Power? (Power $=$ Work $/$ Time, Work $=$ Force $\times$ Displacement)
Given that Mass $= M$, Length $= L$, and Time $= T$, what is the dimension for Pressure? (Pressure $=$ Force $/$ Area, Area $= L^2$)
questions.explanation: Force $= MLT^{-2}$, Area $= L^2$, Pressure $= \dfrac{MLT^{-2}}{L^2} = ML^{-1}T^{-2}$.

questions.question: Given that Mass $= M$, Length $= L$, and Time $= T$, what is the dimension for Force Constant (spring constant)? (Force Constant $=$ Force $/$ Displacement)
questions.explanation: Force $= MLT^{-2}$, Displacement $= L$, Force Constant $= \dfrac{MLT^{-2}}{L} = MT^{-2}$.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered unit conversions, significant figures, and dimensional analysis.
scoreMessages.70: Good work! Review the rules for significant figures in addition and practice deriving dimensions.
scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing. Focus on converting between units and understanding how dimensions combine.
scoreMessages.0: Let's review. Study unit conversions, decimal place rules, and basic dimensional analysis.
